alert.note: Alert for Boone; Delaware; Hamilton; Hancock; Henry; Madison; Tipton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:34AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Madison, northwestern Hancock, Delaware, northern Hendricks, northwestern Henry, northern Marion, southeastern Boone, Hamilton, eastern Tipton and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 233 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tipton to 8 miles south of Crawfordsville. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Tipton and Windfall around 240 AM EDT. Elwood around 250 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Brownsburg, Alexandria, Anderson, Speedway and Muncie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 110 and 140. Interstate 69 between mile markers 200 and 252. Interstate 70 between mile markers 75 and 90. Interstate 74 between mile markers 47 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for central and east central Indiana.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Delaware; Hamilton; Hancock; Henry; Madison; Tipton
